ygData.subject: Re: Mana song strategy. Also Mana-drain song
ygData.msgSnippet: Great, thanks for the info. ... The yucky level of 35. (Forgot to leave name and such in original thread). I m left with one more question still for anyone who
ygData.messageBody:
Great, thanks for the info.

> What level are you? I assume since you are talking about the mana song, you
> are level 32+. All i was thinking was that you are not level 26 yet, when i
> believe it shows up as a skill on Carskin. Or perhaps they made it
> available at a later level, hard to explain.

The yucky level of 35. (Forgot to leave name and such in original thread).

I'm left with one more question still for anyone who can respond.
What is the duration of the mana song? "Your mind clears." Is that the end of
it, or like other songs does it last for 2 more ticks?
I'm guessing that the duration of the mana song is 1 tick only because of the
fact that the mana song is cumulative if you have more than 1 bard in your
party. 2 bards can sing it, and it stacks well. The casters in the party, with
double mana song going, were on some kind of a high.
Anyways, thanks for the info.

Now another quick question thats on a different topic again. I recently hit 35
and was wondering how useful or practical it is to use Denon's Dissension aka
the mana-drain song. I'd think it'd come in handy when fighting some tough
casters or the never-ending mana NPCs, but has anyone tested this against a
friend or anything to see how much and how fast their mana actually drains?
Basically, what I want to know is, should I ever bother memorizing this song?
I'll test it out on my own, but please comment on this if you've had any
experience with it.

Thanks.

Maev Lorekeeper, L35
Tarew Marr
